character.description: Medieval Europe widely believed in Prester John, a fabulously wealthy and powerful Christian king-priest ruling a vast realm in Asia (later thought to be Abyssinia/Ethiopia). Originating in the mid-12th century, the legend held that he had defeated Muslim armies and offered potential aid to the struggling Crusader states, sparking great hope. Popes, like Alexander III in 1177, sent emissaries to contact him, but they failed.
